image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

profileText: A Representative from Tennessee; born in Nashville, Davidson County, Tenn., February 14, 1945; attended Warner public school, 1953-1959; graduated, East Nashville Senior High School, Nashville, Tenn., 1963; B.S., Middle Tennessee State University, Murfreesboro, Tenn., 1967; M.A., George Peabody College, Nashville, Tenn., 1969; member of the Tennessee state house of representatives, 1970-1972, 1974-1976; engaged in banking profession, 1972-1976; law clerk, 1976-1977; member of the Tennessee state senate, 1976-1978; J.D., YMCA Night Law School, Nashville, Tenn., 1978; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-sixth and to the four succeeding Congresses, served until his resignation on October 5, 1987 (January 3, 1979-October 5, 1987); mayor of Nashville, Tenn., 1987-1991; educator; television show host.

asset.name: B000615_001
asset.creditLine: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

researchRecord.name: 1986, 3 commercials on 1 videocassette.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during William Boner's campaign for the 1986 U.S. congressional election in District 5 of Tennessee, Democratic Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication

researchRecord.name: 1979-1987, 14 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: The Bill Boner papers consist primarily of correspondence but also includes House resolutions, campaign organizational materials, booklets, briefings, brochures, newsletters, notes, and studies relating to Bonerâ€™s United States congressional career. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.
